root: ^The alarm clock jolts you awake. It's 9 am, which means you actually slept in from your usual wake-up time of 6 am. But seeing as today is your day off, you suppose it's earned.
^You get out of bed, feeling more refreshed than you have been in awhile. Your morning routine is yours to do as you see fit.

Shower_1: ^You look at yourself in the mirror before you go to jump in the shower.

^Your name is LYLA. You are a woman of STRENGTH. Of beauty. Of some third thing. You are confident, attractive, and depressingly single. It doesn't actually bother you that much, but, y'know, sometimes the yearning gets to you.
^Oh well. We all can't be perfect.
^You take a quick shower. It's nice, but now you're hungry.
Breakfast_1: ^You only have cereal in your home. Typically, the people at the fire station would note your poor nutritional choices and give you a PROPER FIREFIGHTER'S BREAKFAST, but they're not here to lecture you now.
^Special K. You should be somewhat healthy, right?
^Frosted Flakes, the sugariest cereal you own.
Special_K: ^A breakfast of champions, if the champion didn't have anything hearty to really eat.
^But it's okay. The sky is blue, the birds are chirping, you can feel the sunlight on your face even though you’re inside...
^You have a feeling today is going to be a good day.
Frosted_Flakes: ^A breakfast of champions. The champion being the great mascot Tony the Tiger, and millions of children who probably eat too much sugar on a daily basis.
^But it's okay. The sky is blue, the birds are chirping, you can feel the sunlight on your face even though you’re inside...
^You have a feeling today is going to be a good day.
Outside_1: ^You decide to go walk towards the park. As you make your way, you’re mentally mapping what you want your day to be like in your head. Even if it’s your day off, you gotta keep up your firefighter physique, so you should probably hit the gym. Oh, but, the café near the park has really good pastries, and--
^Something crashes into you. Or, rather, someone with something. You feel an ice cold liquid hitting your shirt, and you look down.
^Shit, someone spilled coffee on your shirt. You back up, ready to give this person a piece of your mind, when...

^A cute girl is clutching the remnants of her iced latte, staring at you with wide eyes. She looks mortified, and you would be rushing to say something if it weren’t your lizard brain hooking onto the fact that she’s cute.
^“I wasn’t looking where I was going, oh gosh, I didn’t mean to…”
^She trails off, waiting for your answer.
^“Oh, it’s fine, don’t worry about it.”
^“What the fuck? This was my favorite tank-top!”
Shirt_1: ^You shrug. It was an honest mistake, and it doesn’t really bother you. Still, that doesn’t quell her frantic desperation to apologize, it seems.
^“But still! I really need to look where I’m going...”
^“No, honestly, it’s fine. I’ve had worse.”
^You’ve definitely gotten salsa on this shirt before, so you’re used to having this shirt be a mess.
^“Um, wait, maybe--I have a stain remover stick and a handkerchief.”
^The girl starts to rummage through her purse, eventually producing what is, indeed, a stick and a handkerchief. She offers them to you.
^“Y-yeah, well, I like to be prepared… This happens to me a lot.”
^She fidgets, still holding her hand out.
Shirt_2: ^Yeah, she might be cute, but she RUINED A GOOD TANK-TOP. You fix her with a deadpan glare. She starts to tear up a little, which makes you feel kinda bad, but not enough to not be angry.
^“I-I’m so sorry… I’m just such a klutz sometimes…”
^“Yeah, well, it’s gonna be hard to get the stain out of this.”
^“Um, wait, maybe--I have a stain remover stick and a handkerchief.”
^The girl starts to rummage through her purse, eventually producing what is, indeed, a stick and a handkerchief. She offers them to you.
^“Y-yeah, well, I like to be prepared… This happens to me a lot.”
^She fidgets, still holding her hand out.
Stuff_1: ^You take the stick and start to apply it to the stain, dabbing it with the handkerchief. The stain fades a little, but isn’t totally gone. It’s mildly irritating, but truly, Salsa Night was worse, and you managed to get that out with a good laundry wash.
^Oh boy. You were thinking about Salsa Night, and your expression darkened. That probably scared the poor girl.
^“Yeah, everything’s fine. I’ll probably just have to get this in the wash or something.”
^The girl frowns, and the two of you fall into an awkward silence. You decide to break the tension, so you don’t see her burst into tears.
^The girl smiles a little at that. “My name’s Gigi. What’s yours?”
^“It’s nice to meet you Lyla!” Gigi smiles, lighting up her face.

^Your lizard brain conveniently reminds you that 1. She is cute and 2. You are, as stated before, depressingly single. The yearning IS getting to you. Maybe this is your chance to actually ask a girl out on a date!
^At the same time, even though you are suave, you need to take things slow, make sure you’re picking up the signals correctly.
^“Soo, uhh, what’s your opinion on flannels?”
Line_1: ^“It’s always nice to meet a cute girl ‘round these parts.”
^You say this in a drawl, and then internally cringe.
^Oh god, that was a terrible line. What were you even trying to do? Despite your unsuave-ness, she giggles, her cheeks reddening.
^She says it shyly, and yes! She likes women! This is a win in your books.
Abs_1: ^You not-so-discreetly lift up your abs and dab at them lightly with the handkerchief. You catch Gigi’s eye and find that her face is beet-red, but she’s not looking away.
^You smirk, and wow, this is going a little overboard, maybe.
^But your suaveness seems to be working, so you’ll count this as a win.
Flannels_1: ^The universal symbol of women-loving-women folks, you think? You’re not really sure, but. You like flannel, so that’s good enough.
^“Oh, flannels are nice… I don’t wear them a ton, but I think they’re a good fashion choice. For, um, women, specifically. Why do you ask?”
^Well. That seems like a positive sign.
Hand_1: ^You hand the stuff back to Gigi, the tips of your fingers brushing hers. Wow, they’re soft. She draws hers back delicately, her gaze not leaving yours.
^“So, uh… you new around here?” You ask.
^“Oh, yes! Just moved into my apartment about a week ago. The neighborhood’s really nice.”
^The two of you lapse back into an awkward silence. It’s not wholly unpleasant, but something seems to be weighing on Gigi’s mind. You move to speak, but--
^“I really can pay you back for the laundry bill though!”
^She rushes her words nervously, hands moving towards her purse. “How much is it?”
^“Oh, but I just feel so guilty… please, let me buy you coffee and a pastry or something from the café around the corner.”
^“ I had their blueberry muffin today, it was so good…”
^Hm. Hmm. This could be your chance… if you’re up for it.
^Be suave. “Sure, let’s make it a date.”
^No, you’re not up for it. Just take the money and go.
Suave_1: ^“Oh! Um… yes, that’d be… nice. A date would be very nice.”
^You give a seductive wink that you can tell makes Gigi swoon. Goddamn, you’re good at this.
Baby_1: ^“Oh! Um… yes, that’d be… nice. A date would be very nice.”
^You fumble your words, but you know your grin is sexy as hell. And sometimes, that’s enough in life.
No_1: ^Admittedly, you are a little annoyed still about the coffee stain. You hold your hand out.
^“Sure, I was just headed that way now.”
^Gigi looks at you, almost as if she were expecting something. When you quirk an eyebrow, she sighs, dropping her gaze.
Firetruck_1: ^Despite your awesomeness, you do still feel a nervous buzzing as you walk towards the café, Gigi next to you. You haven’t gone on a date in a while, so you’re not entirely sure what to do. Should you hold her hand?
^No, that’s too much. You want to take things slow.

^Gigi looks at you, smiling and your heart skips a beat. Sirens are blasting in your head, yelling at you. You’re feeling anxious and cursing yourself for being this cheesy and also you’re maybe having indigestion from the cereal. Not really sure.
^You try not to let the nerves show. The sirens grow louder in your head, and you try to breathe deeply and calm down.
^It becomes harder to listen to Gigi, because the sirens are growing louder. Except, wait--they’re not in your head, are they. It’s outside.

^You look away and see a firetruck hurtling towards you. You don’t have enough time to dodge the firetruck hurtling towards you. You only have enough time to process, Huh, that’s weird, before the firetruck hurtling towards you crunches your bones.
Firetruck_1_Alone: ^The tension is way too thick as the two of you make your way towards the café. Sirens blast in your head, reminding you - yet again - Gigi is cute. It makes you a little nervous.
^You wonder, briefly, if you could’ve done things differently, patched it over with Gigi, but really, the shirt thing is hard to get over.
^Anyway, Gigi lives in the neighborhood. If you want to make amends, you can always find her some other time, probably.
^“So, um, what do you do?” Gigi asks.
^You try not to let the nerves show. The sirens grow louder in your head, and you try to breathe deeply and calm down.
^It becomes harder to listen to Gigi, because the sirens are growing louder. Except, wait--they’re not in your head, are they. It’s outside.

^You look away and see a firetruck hurtling towards you. You don’t have enough time to dodge the firetruck hurtling towards you. You only have enough time to process, Huh, that’s weird, before the firetruck hurtling towards you crunches your bones.
Day_Two: ^The alarm clock jolts you awake. You quickly sit up in bed and feel that you do indeed still have all your limbs, and are not a pulpy mess on the concrete.
^That dream felt way too real. But you’re happy that you weren’t killed by a firetruck. That’s just way too on the nose.
^It's 9am, which means you actually slept in from your usual wake-up time of 6am. But seeing as today is your day off, you suppose it's earned.
^You get out of bed, feeling more refreshed than you have been in awhile. Your morning routine is yours to do as you see fit.
Dressed_Day_Two: ^While getting dressed, you catch a glimpse of yourself in the mirror.
^You flex in the mirror, admiring your own physique.
^You are Lyla, the local firefighter. Confident, attractive, and so depressingly single. While this fact doesn’t normally bother you, sometimes you wish you had someone else around.
^Finally dressed, your stomach starts to growl.
Breakfast_Day_Two: ^You only have cereal in your home. Your coworkers at the firestation normally rag on you for your poor dietary choices, but they’re not here right now.
^Frosted Flakes. A little sugar never hurt anyone!
Frosted_Day_Two: ^The perfect meal for your day off. Normally, Amy or Jason cook up a PROPER FIREFIGHTER'S BREAKFAST that consists of more than just sugar for people like you.
^While pouring a bowl for yourself, you feel like you’ve done this before. Odd considering this is your first day off in who knows how long.
^You shake off the feeling and  shove a spoonful of the sweet cereal into your mouth, and think about how angry Amy would be at you right now.
^A good breakfast you think, but you notice the cafe across the street.
Special_Day_Two: ^The perfect meal for your day off. Normally, Amy or Jason cook up a PROPER FIREFIGHTER'S BREAKFAST that has more nutritional value than freeze dried strawberries for people like you.
^While pouring a bowl for yourself, you feel like you’ve done this before. Odd considering this is your first day off in who knows how long.
^You shake off the feeling and shove a spoonful of the cereal into your mouth, and think about how angry Amy would be at you right now.
^A good breakfast you think, but you notice the cafe across the street.
Cafe_Day_Two: ^You look between the two options, and feel… strange. Like you’ve been only eating cereal for years. You glance out the window and see the cafe across the street.
Outside_Day_Two: ^A fresh danish with some coffee sounds so good right now… Oh and they have the BEST blueberry muffins. And-
^Before you even realize it, you’re out the door.
^It’s a nice day out. The birds are chirping, and the feeling of fresh air and sunlight feels amazing on your skin. It’s nice to enjoy the city when it’s not literally on fire.
^You have a feeling that today is going to be a go-
^Something crashes into you. Or, rather, someone with something. You feel an ice cold liquid hitting your shirt, and you look down.
^Shit, someone spilled their drink on your shirt. Thankfully, it was clear, so it shouldn’t stain. You back up, ready to give this person a piece of your mind, when...

^A cute girl is clutching the remnants of her drink, staring at you with wide eyes. She looks mortified, and you would be rushing to say something if it weren’t for the fact that your lizard brain is hooked onto the fact that she’s cute.
^Really cute, you think, frowning. You know you’ve never met this girl before, but you feel like you know her. Maybe she was also a regular at the cafe?
^“I wasn’t looking where I was going, oh gosh, I didn’t mean to…”
^She trails off, waiting for your answer.
^I feel like I’ve seen you before….
Met_Before_Day_Two: ^“This is going to sound so odd, but have we met before?”
^She blushes and starts fiddling with her hands.
Dream_Day_Two: ^“I feel like I’ve seen you before… Maybe in a dream?”
^She blushes and starts stuttering. You realize what you’ve just said and start blushing as well. Why did you say that?
^“I-I just mean you look really familiar, that’s all. Maybe I’ve seen you around the cafe?”
Continue_Day_Two: ^She looks like she wants to say more, but doesn’t. You know that she’s probably right, but there’s something about her that makes you feel like you already know her.
^The girl rummages through her bag and pulls out a small towel and a stain stick remover. She offers them to you.
^“Here, use this. It’s the least I can do.”
^You take the towel and stick, drying your shirt before applying the stick. The girl nods. The stain eventually fades.
^“Happy that I decided not to get a coffee today!”

^She laughs a little awkwardly, and plays with her hair. You look at her again. You can’t shake the feeling that you’ve met her before. You realize you’ve been staring at her for a minute too long without saying anything, and decide to break the silence.
^You say and put the towel on your shoulder. You hold out your hand for her to shake it.
^She shakes your hand and giggles. Something about her laugh makes your heart flutter a little. Maybe this is your chance to leave the single life?
Goodbye_Day_Two: ^The two of you stand in silence for too long. Even though your shirt’s not stained, you’re annoyed at the mild inconvenience and hiccup in your day.
^“Well it was nice to meet you--”
^“Wait, let me buy you a coffee or something. I know it didn’t stain, but I still feel terrible.”
^“I insist. There’s a place down the street? Really good muffins?”
^She bites her lip and twirls her hair. Either she really wants to make it up to you or she’s into you. Well- you know she’s probably into you, assuming she swings that way. This is your chance.
^“Well I never could turn down a free muffin...”
No_Day_Two: ^“It’s my only day off, and I kinda had a whole thing planned that involved a lot of me time. So…”
^You trail off, not sure how to continue. Her face falls, and you feel your heart sink. She looks like a wounded puppy.
^What should have worked? You assume you meant at her attempt to ask you out, but that was such an odd way of phrasing it.
^She flounders over her words. You feel kinda bad. You are heading that way anyway…
^“I mean, I was heading that way. But I’ll just take a coffee to go.”
^She perks up at this, but is still obviously disappointed.
Date_Day_Two: ^She says it a bit too loud and eager.
^She clears her throat, blush rising in her cheeks.
^“I mean, that’s great. Have you been to the place down the street?”
^“That place? Best coffee in the area, guaranteed.”
^“And their muffins are pretty good too, although, I’m not sure they’re the best in the area.”
^You two walk toward the cafe together, falling into an awkward silence.
Free_Day_Two: ^“Their coffee is pretty good too. Best in the area.”
^Gigi brightens at your acceptance. It looks like she starts bouncing a little before stopping. God, she is too cute.
^You two walk toward the cafe together, falling into an awkward silence.
PickUp_Line_Day_Two: ^“When I get my coffee, I’ll make sure to tell them to hold the sugar. It seems you’re sweet enough.”
^You immediately regret your words the second they come tumbling out of your mouth. Why did you say something so corny?
^Your terrible line seems to work, as Gigi fails at hiding her laughter. Your heart beats a bit faster. Her laugh isn’t anything special, but it just--UGH WHY ARE GIRLS SO CUTE?
^You just barely hear her mutter something, but can’t quite catch it. Before you can ask, she reaches for the towel.
^Her fingers brush past your cheek and suddenly you can’t even remember your own name. Was that on purpose? You can feel your cheeks turning red.
^“Oh no! Well yes, but no… I lived on the other side of the city for a bit, but just recently moved into a smaller place over here. It’s nice.”
^You fall into an awkward silence. You don’t want to just leave, but don’t know what to say. You want to say something- anything! But your brain seems to be purposely failing you.
^You open your mouth hoping that something coherent will tumble out.
^“I could--uh, I mean--I know you ran into me but--”
^You barely were able to get the words out but it seems Gigi must have gathered what you were trying to say. You grin at her.
^“I know this great local place close by.”
^You motion to the cafe down the street, and smile.

^Gigi blinks in surprise. You assume she’s not used to someone being so forward. She nods and smiles. Your heart flutters again. You two walk toward the cafe together, falling into an awkward silence.
Ask_Day_Two: ^“Well, my coffee hasn’t kicked in yet, so I can’t think of a charming pick up line, but would you like to get a coffee sometime? I know this great local place close by.”
^You motion to the cafe down the street, and smile.

^Gigi blinks in surprise. You assume she’s not used to someone being so forward. She nods and smiles. Your heart flutters again. You two walk toward the cafe together, falling into an awkward silence.
Date_Continue: ^“So… how do you know it’s the best coffee?”
^“Well, it says so on the sign of course. They would never lie like that.”
^You grin at her as she suppresses her laughter. She playfully hits your arm and rolls her eyes.
^“So… what’s it like being a firefighter?”
^Wait. When did you tell her you were a firefighter? You frown slightly and a strange look comes across Gigi’s face. Confusion? No. You can’t put your finger on it.
^She says it quickly and tucks her hair behind her ear. She laughs slightly, but it doesn’t meet her eyes.
^“Right, my bad. Memory of a jellyfish I swear.”
Moved_Day_Two: ^“To be closer to my potential job. I want to be a professor at the university.”
^“I, um, just finished grad school for quantum physics. But I’m sure you don’t want to hear about that. What--”
^“Yeah, It’s hard work, but really interesting. Well, at least to me…”
^She looks at you, but you’re still too shocked to respond. You can barely wrap your head around normal physics let alone quantum physics.
Job_Day_Two: ^“Oh, um, nothing too exciting. Or at least, nothing as exciting as your job.”
^“I just finished grad school in the research of quantum physics. I’m hoping to become a professor some day.”
^“I just moved here to be closer to the university in hopes that they’d hire me.”
^“And how, pray tell, is that not exciting?!”
Continue_Job_2: ^You, yourself, just barely got your associates before joining the academy. Cute AND smart?? Who is this girl???
^Lost in your thoughts, you don’t notice that you were walking straight into oncoming traffic. You don’t even hear the sirens, and saw the flash of red a touch too late when--
^Gigi had grabbed your arm and pulled you back to the safety at the last second. You put your hand over your heart, trying to calm yourself. You almost died via firetruck. How ironic would that be?
^She’s still holding your arm, and now you aren’t sure if it was the near death experience or her hand that was making your heart race.
^The walk light turns on, but she still doesn’t let go as you cross. You should say something. Make a joke? Pretend you know anything about quantum physics? Change the topic completely?
^Why did the fireman cross the road?
Physics_Day_Two: ^“I know nothing about it. How does it differ from normal physics? Don’t be afraid to use big words.”

^She smiles and starts to use terms that you can’t even begin to understand. You open the door to the cafe for her while she prattles on about… something. You’re not 100% sure if she’s still speaking English.
^You order a coffee and muffin for yourself. It seems like she didn’t realize you two had reached your destination.
^“So it turns out that-- Oh! Just an iced coffee for me, thank you.”
^She finally realized and handed the barista her card. You sat at a table by the window to wait for your drinks. You pick at your muffin while she continues.
^“But yeah, it’s hard work, but so interesting and rewarding! Especially when a theory proves to be true. Or at least thought to be true.”
^She beams at you and you nod. It’s obvious that you have no idea what she had said.
^“Sorry, I rambled for way too long. What’s your day to day as a firefighter like?”
^“It’s pretty routine. Assuming the actual city isn’t burning down, I can fit in a workout before answering real calls.”
^You flex your arm and you see her hand twitch, like she wanted to feel it. She didn’t try to hide her staring. You suppress your laughter.
^“Aside from that my day to day is…”
Hobbies_Shop_2: ^“Have any fun hobbies? If you couldn’t tell, I’m a bit of a gym rat.”
^You flex your arm and you see her hand twitch, like she wanted to feel it. She didn’t try to hide her staring.
^“Oh, uhm, I really like to read romance novels, as cheesy as it sounds. Not the real raunchy ones, but the ones with weird plots, I guess? Like time loops or forbidden romances...”
^“It’s just fun because they’re all so weird. Romance authors don’t really care about anything making sense, but instead just trying to make something fun.”

^You open the door to the cafe for her while she prattles on about an incredibly absurd novel she just recently finished. Something about the two love interest switching bodies whenever they got too close?
^You order a coffee and muffin for yourself. It seems like she didn’t realize you two had reached your destination.
^“So it turned out in the end love interest X was the one who-- Oh! Just an iced coffee for me, thank you.”

^“But yeah, turns out love interest X didn’t realize how hard it was to force a meeting between worlds and had to accept that they’d never be together…”
^Her voice trailed off. She looked so sad for a moment before perking back up.
^“Sorry, I rambled for way too long. Are you much of a reader?”
^“More of a podcast gal, not much time to sit down and read. I also am a bit of a gym rat, if you couldn’t tell.”
^You flex your arm and you see her hand twitch, like she wanted to feel it. She didn’t try to hide her staring. You suppress your laughter.
^“My most recent podcast is a narrative one about…”

^“Oh well there was this one about…”

^You know that you would never read it, but it seemed to be something she cared about. And it’s not hurting you to listen.
^“So once they get within a few feet of each other, they swap bodies with someone else?”
^“Yes, but no. The REAL kicker is…”

^She snorted and together you two crossed the street. Safely this time.

^“Sorry, I rambled for way too long. Are you much of a reader?”

^You flex your arm and you see her hand twitch, like she wanted to feel it. She didn’t try to hide her staring. You suppress your laughter.
^“My most recent podcast is a narrative one about…”
Bad_Joke_2: ^She raises an eyebrow interested to see where this was going.
^“To take the cute girl to the coffee shop.”
^You wink and she rolls her eyes. Her mouth twists as she suppresses her laughter.
^“Come on, laugh. I know I’m hilarious.”
^She shakes her head as you two cross the street.
^“I refuse to give you that one. Nope. Not funny. Not one bit.”
^You hold the door open to the cafe for her.
^She ignores you and orders an iced coffee. You order a coffee and muffin. You two sit by the window while you wait for your drinks.
^“Is making bad jokes a past time of yours?”
^“Bad jokes? Nah. I only make high quality ones. Here, what do you do when…”
End_Day_Two: ^Your drinks come soon after and the two of you talk a little while longer as you finish your coffee. You couldn’t remember specifics, but it was pleasant.
^All too soon your coffee is empty and you realize you should try to make it to the part for a run before it gets too late.
^“I should probably get going. Want to get in a run this morning.”
^Gigi nods, but doesn’t try to hide her disappointment. As you're leaving the cafe, she pulls out a pen from her bag.
^Her face is beet-red, and her voice was a bit still as she asked.
^Wordlessly you took the pen from her and scribbled your number on her arm. You’re happy she asked before you could forget.
^She stares at her arm and then back at you. You wink at her and give a small wave goodbye. She waves back, a huge smile plastered onto her face.

^You turn quickly and start toward the park across the way. You can hear her yelling your name, and look back over your shoulder, assuming she had a problem reading one of the numbers. It’s not until you step into the road that you hear the sirens mixing in with her voice.

^You look and see a firetruck hurtling towards you. You don’t have enough time to dodge the firetruck hurtling towards you. You only have enough time to process, Huh, that’s ironic, before the firetruck hurtling towards you crunches your bones.
Firetruck_2_Alone: ^The walk over is quiet and awkward. Gigi is sulking slightly. You feel like a jerk for rejecting her, but this is one of your few days off.
^And she does live in the neighborhood. Maybe you could give her your number before you leave? You glance at her. She is still pretty cute.

^Yeah. That;s what you’ll do. Try to smooth things out, give her your number, if she’ll take it, and try to see her another day. Just because today didn’t work, doesn’t mean that there’s still not a future.
^“So, um, you don’t get many days off as a firefighter?”
^“Yeah, it’s hard work. I have “days off”, but I’m usually still on call. Today’s one of the few days I have no responsibilities.”
^Gigi nods and says something, but you’re not listening. When did you tell her your profession?
^Alarm bells start ringing, and you stop in your tracks. You go over your conversion again.
^The bells are getting louder. You’re almost positive you never told her.
^You hear Gigi say your name again, but her voice was far away and the alarm was so loud. You looked at her.
^“I never told you I was a firefighter.”
^She flinches, and doesn’t seem to have a response. Was she some kind of stalker? Did she plan all this? You should probably improve your home security.
^She takes a few steps toward you and you take a few back.

^You turn on your heel and quickly start to walk back to your apartment. You can hear her yelling your name, but ignore it. It’s not until you step into the road that you hear the sirens mixing in with her voice.

^You look and see a firetruck hurtling towards you. You don’t have enough time to dodge the firetruck hurtling towards you. You only have enough time to process, This is a weird deja vu, before the firetruck hurtling towards you crunches your bones.
Day_Three: ^Your breathing is labored as you sit up in bed. What the hell was that? A dream inside a dream?
^Not the first time you’ve had a dream like that, but certainly the first time it felt that real.
^It's 9am, which means you actually slept in from your usual wake-up time of 6am. But seeing as today is your day off, you suppose it's earned.
^You get out of bed, but instead of feeling refreshed like you thought you would, there’s a dull ache in your bones. Weird, maybe you slept wrong?
^While debating what the best way to alleviate this is, your phone buzzes on the table beside your bed. You reach over, seeing a text from a number you don’t recognize.
^The text reads: “Morning Lyla!!! I’m so excited for you to meet my parents!!! They’re meeting us for brunch at the cafe near your apartment!”
^Parents? Lunch? This has to be a wrong number right? But that doesn’t explain why it’s addressed to you.
^“Sorry, I think you have the wrong number.”
^“Are you meeting me here or at the cafe?”
Wrong_Day_Three: ^They respond: “‘Have you still not saved my number?” and added a few emojis.
^You scroll up a bit and find that this is not your first conversation with this person. Your heart starts beating a bit. Texts go back quite a bit. How have you just forgotten this much time?
^You text them back: “I don’t know who you are.”
Who_Day_Three: ^They respond: “‘It’s me silly! Gigi? Your girlfriend? Did you hit your head this morning?”
^You stare blankly at the screen. Are you losing it? Should you go anyway? Is this another dream?
^While you contemplate your own existence and lapse in memory, Gigi calls you.
^“Hey, everything okay? Should I tell them we need to reschedule?”
^The voice is sweet and familiar. You’ve heard it before. Where have you heard it before? Where-
^“My dream. That’s how I know you!”
^You blurt it out before you know what you’re saying. You hear her laugh on the other end.
^“You used that same line on me for our first date. Running out of bad material?”
^First date? Hazy memories from what you thought was a dream start coming back to you. You pinch yourself to see if you’re actually awake.
^“Aaannnyyway. I’ll be outside your apartment soon, and then we can walk over together?”
^She makes a kiss sound and then hangs up. Have you completely lost it? Why did you agree? What is even going on?
^Well, you’ve already agreed, so you can’t go back now. Might as well get ready.
Meeting_Day_Three: ^They respond: “I can be outside your apartment soon, and then we can walk over together?”
^You respond with a thumbs up. Why did you agree? Who is this person? How are you getting through this? All very good questions that you don’t have the answers for.
^You scroll through past texts to try to gain some more information about who the mystery texter is and how they know you.
^Apparently, the two of you have been dating for a little while now, her name is Gigi, and…. That’s all you can gather. All the texts feel… so scripted? Some of them don’t even sound like you.
^It gives you a weird feeling, but you try to ignore it. Nothing is weirder than the fact you’re about to go on a date with some girl that, to your knowledge, just appeared in your life today.
Meet_Gigi_3: ^While getting dressed, you catch a glimpse of yourself in the mirror.
^You wink at yourself before continuing to get ready. You think you’re about ready when you realize maybe you should have dressed up a bit more. You are meeting the parents after all.
^Before you have time to change you get a text from Gigi, saying she’s here.
^Well, it’s too late to change now. You pull on your shoes and meet her outside.
^You’re happy she said something so you knew who she was, but somehow you still know her. Her face is familiar. You know you’ve never met, but memories with her tickle the back of your head.
^She’s way better dressed than you are. You feel a bit embarrassed, but then realize you shouldn’t. It’s not like you really know this person- Let alone her parents.
^She takes your hand as the two of you walk to the cafe. Despite not knowing her, you still feel… comfortable? Like you’ve known her for longer than the few minutes it takes to walk to the cafe.
^“So, Dad’s name is Jerlod and Mom’s is Kristle, but that’s spelled K-R-I-S-T-L-E. She’s very particular about it.”
^“Don’t bring up Dad’s fishing trip last year or his new DIY kick.”
^“He thinks he can re-do the entire bathroom, INCLUDING THE PLUMBING. He’s an accountant at H&R Block and yet he insists that he can do everything!”
^Sounds like a typical dad to you, but she’s obviously very annoyed by it. It reminds you of when your dad thought he could refurbish the deck. Although, he was a carpenter….

^“Oh, and for mom… Don’t bring up her cooking… or sewing… or well… She doesn’t like the reminder that she’s not the perfect 1950s housewife. Even though she INSISTS that women are more than their ability to cook. I don’t know!”
^She throws her hand in the air in frustration. You have a feeling this might not be as easy going of a brunch as you thought.
^“Is there anything that I’m allowed to talk about?”
Talk_About_3: ^“Uhm… My mom used to be an actress, or at least that’s what she says.”
^She says this, but doesn’t seem to believe it herself.
^“My dad… Well, it’s a bit of a mixed bag. Maybe sports? He also might be interested in your job?”
^She furrows her brow in thought, and continues to mutter about vague things that her dad might like.
Enter_Cafe_3: ^You hold the door open to the cafe for her, and the two of you sit by the window while you wait for her parents. You bounce your knee and look out the window.

^It’s all coming down on you now. What are you doing here? Why did you agree to come? How are you going to get through a brunch when the only thing you know about your so called girlfriend is her name?
Faking_3: ^You decide you should try to fake a stomach ache. Then you can decide what to do about Gigi. That will be a hard conversion, but at least it wouldn’t be brunch-with-the-parents awkward.
^“Oh, here they are! Hold that thought.”
^She waves down an older couple. They sit across from the two of you.
Your_Choice: ^You may as well go through with this, no matter how badly it goes. If it becomes too painfully awkward, you can always just leave.
^She nods and squeezes your hand. You give her a tight lipped smile in response. She looks like she wants to say something when an older couple walks through the door.
^She waves them down. They sit across from the two of you.
Parent_3: ^An older woman who looks like the embodiment of red wine, and a bald maw who seems WAY too confident walk in.
^“Oh our dear Gigi has told us so much about you, Lyla.”
^You glance at Gigi next to you and her cheeks are tinged pink. Her hands are balled up on her lap. That can’t be good.
^She mumbles it, but you can still clearly hear her. Jerold pats her hand. Gigi’s cheeks puff up, now bright red.
^Based on the texts, the two of you haven’t been dating for that long. Certainly not long enough to even consider marriage.
^Point out good things on the menu.
No_Ring_3: ^It comes out a bit more aggressive than you mean to, but you don’t really care. It’s your first meeting and they’re already asking about marriage?
^Kristle frowns at you, but doesn’t say anything more.
^He waves his hand at you dismissively.
^“All that matters is that you two love each other, right? What else really matters?”
^A lot of things.You can feel your blood start to boil. You don’t want to make a scene, but still can’t just let this slide.
^Gigi said, changing the subject. She squeezed your hand again. You take a breath. No need to cause a scene right now. Just get through the brunch.
^“Yes, the whole reason we came here!”
Acting_3: ^“So, Gigi told me you were an actress?”
^Changing the subject seemed like a good call. Jerlod rolled his eyes, but Kristle smiled widely. Gigi let out a sigh of relief and gently squeezed your knee under the table.
^“Oh, honey, I’m still an actress. Just in between gigs at the moment.”
^“Have you been in anything I’ve seen?”
^“A few commercials here and there. I volunteer at the local theater when they are in need of my talent.”
^“Kristle is very talented. It’s only a matter of time before she makes it big.”

^You nod. She talks a bit more about her most recent commercial for a prescription drug meant to help with skin irritation. You don’t watch much TV, but it sounds similar to one of the four ads that plays on the TV at the station.
^Kristle is visibly taken back, before composing herself.
^It was posed as a question, but for some reason it felt like more of a statement. The look she gave you was almost daring you say no. Daring you to say she wasn’t in the commercial.
Nope_3: ^“I’ve only seen it a few times, but I don’t recognize your face.”
^Kristle smiled again, but it didn’t meet her eyes. You very quickly realize the mistake you’ve made. Why didn’t you just agree?
^“Well, I could also be thinking of the wrong one.”
^Why did that feel like such a threat? You shift in your seat under Kristle’s gaze.
^“Yes, the whole reason we came here!”
Saw_3: ^She smiled again, but it didn’t meet her eyes. Even if she wasn’t a real actress, she was good at putting on a face.
^“Yes, the whole reason we came here!”
Menu_3: ^“Well, I’m usually here for breakfast. Any of the pastries are good, but--”
^“How often do you come here? They don’t keep you on a tighter leash?”
^You can’t even begin to understand what that could possibly mean. Who is “they”?
^“Well, they have good coffee. Best in the area!”
^You try to make a joke, but no one laughs. You shrink in your seat a little.
^“Hmm, caffeine is an addictive drug you know. Saw that in the news.”
^“Yeah, as a firefighter, you should probably kick that habit. Can’t be good for you.”
^You blink at them. Should you even say anything? Is it worth it?
^“I had their caprese panini the other day, Mom, you should get that. Dad…”

^She’s talking fast, trying to change the subject. Kristle asks for some sugar free soy latte, while Jerold gets an Americano. Fitting, somehow, that they both get coffees after telling you to stop drinking it.
^You nod. Gigi goes to stand up, but Kristle stops her.
^“Oh no dear, just flag down the waitress. It’s their job to serve us after all.”
^She starts waving at the barista, who looks confused.
^“Mom, pease, it’s not that kind of--”
^Gigi collapses back into her seat while Kristle tries to get the barista to come down. Jerold pulls a few dollar bills from his wallet and put them on the table’s edge.
^“I read about this in the paper. You keep the bills on the edge so the staff can see it. Then remove them one at a time if they do poorly.”
^You cannot believe what he just said. Don’t servers already get paid pennies? And now they have to meet your personal standards for five bucks?
Order_3: ^You go to the counter. You hear Kristle loudly re-explaining her drink to you and Gigi trying to shush her. You ignore them.
^At the counter you ask for everyone’s order and just a danish for yourself.
^“I apologize in advance if they’re awful to you.”
^“I’m used to it. I’ll get those out for you in a few.”
^You thank them, take a deep breath and walk back to the table. You only have to get through a little longer. Just a little longer.
^You sit back at the table and pretend that everything’s fine. Gigi takes your hand, and whispers an apology. You squeeze her hand in response.
Say_3: ^“Is that not cruel? The servers already don’t get paid enough.”
^“Not my fault they can’t do their job well, or can’t work hard enough to get a better job.”
^You take a deep breath, and look steadily at Jeold. You refuse to believe this is a real person sitting in front of you. You look at Gigi.
^Gigi winces, but neither Jerold nor Kristle seemed to hear you.
^You shake your head. You’re too mad. How can you-
^The barista finally makes their way to the table. They’re visibly confused.
^“Oh, well actually, you have to order at the register.”
^“Nonsense. Gigi, tell them what we want.”
^Gigi’s face is bright red. The barista smiles with the customer service smile they have. Jerlod removes a dollar from the edge of the table.
^Kristle rattles off an order that was 90% her latte and then waved the server away. The look in their eyes could kill.
^They stiffly walk back to the counter.
Mainsplain_3: ^“Yes, have been for a few years now.”
^“I was almost a firefighter you know. Do they still make you take all those tests?”
^“Did you decide to be one because you couldn’t be a doctor? Or EMT?”
^You’re speechless. Does he know literally anything about the qualifications of a firefighter?
^“I decided to not be one because everyone at the station was just bitter that they weren’t smart enough for med school.”
^“Ah! I’m sure you were just a pyromaniac as a kid right? You know, 67% of firefights either were or are pyromaniacs, and 35% of them actually purposely start 14% of the fires.”
^The barista arrives at the table, handing out drinks and giving you a pastry. You thank them before they leave.
^Kristle stares at you and the cheese danish in front of you.
^“You would think they would have you on a strict diet at the station.” Jerold
^Kristle smiles at you. Every word of her next sentence, dripping in passive-agressive sweetness.
^That’s it. You’ve had enough. It’s time to go.
Leave_3: ^“Well, it was nice to meet the both of you, but I think I have to go.”
^You stand up. You don’t look at Gigi. She grabs your hand, but you shake it off.
^She takes a sip of her drink before spitting it out.
^“Ugh, there’s no way this is coconut milk.”
^Kristle gets up and goes to the counter, while Jerold takes away another dollar.
^It’s time to go, you know that much, but do you leave loudly or quietly?
Quietly_3: ^It’s not worth making a scene over. You just quietly leave, leaving a heavy $20 in the tip jar.
Loudly_3: ^You loudly vent your frustrations. You’re making a scene, but you don’t really care.

^“I’m not a pyromaniac nor did I want to be a doctor. I just like helping people, but firefighting paid better than EMT. Jerold, don’t act like you know what you’re talking about. You don’t. It’s so obvious you don’t!”
^Jerold looks taken back, but you don’t wait around long enough to see if he has anything to say. Walking past the counter,you leave a heavy $20 tip in the tip jar and apologize to the barista.
^“And YOU. Just because you appeared in one commercial for three seconds doesn’t mean you’re hot shit. Both of you need to get a reality check!”
Death_3: ^Gigi follows you out the door. She’s upset.
^“I’m sorry. I didn’t think--I’m sorry. Please--”
^You stop her. You don’t want to hear it.
^“Listen, they’re your parents. I get that. But I can’t right now. I’ll--I’ll text you later okay?”
^You’re suddenly exhausted. You just want to go home and collapse onto your bed. You want to forget about Gigi and her parents.
^She takes your hand, but you pull away.
^You just blurt that out in frustration. So much for your plan of letting her down easy.
^“What…? Are you breaking up with me?”
^You don’t wait for her response and start walking home with your head down. You can hear her yelling your name, but you don’t turn around. Just ignore her. Just keep going.
^You hear sirens in the distance, trying to focus on that sound, anything to block out her voice.
^You stop. The sirens are getting louder. You debate going back, apologizing. Working it out. You don’t know what you’d be working out but maybe-

^You look back and see a firetruck hurtling towards you. You don’t have enough time to dodge the firetruck. You only have enough time to process, This feels familiar, before the firetruck hurtling towards you crunches your bones.
Day_Four: ^You’re beginning to suspect that something’s off. You can feel the impact of the firetruck that smashed into you, multiple times, but your bones are in one piece. Or, uh, multiple pieces. As bones should be.
^You hear a RUSTLING next to you. Your entire body goes on alert.
^Maybe wait and see what it is first???
Punch_Day_Four: ^You don’t even hesitate as you draw your arm back and move to punch the rustling. But just as you do--

^You see Gigi - the girl, from before??? Right??? What??? - dart up and out from the covers. She glares at you, uncharacteristically. Maybe. Your mind is still fuzzy, but you know she hasn’t done that before.
^Of course, you didn’t try and punch her from before… right?
^“I, uh… I am… so sorry,” you mumble.
^But, just like that, Gigi’s angry expression smoothes back into a smile.
^“It’s okay, babe, nightmares happen,” she says sweetly.
Wait_Day_Four: ^You stay completely still, waiting for the thing in your bed to move. Maybe it’s a really big bug? Oh, you hope not. That’d be gross.
^But the thing gets up from the covers, yawning, and--
^It’s. Gigi? The girl from the other days? You… you went on a date with her, maybe? Your mind is still a little fuzzy, but you can’t comprehend just exactly why she’s here.
^“Oh… good morning, Lyla,” she yawns, smiling up at you.
What_Day_Four: ^At your shocked expression, Gigi’s smile fades. She looks confused.
^“I just… I don’t know,” you answer.
^Your mind races a little too fast for your liking. If you didn’t know any better, you would assume that you’ve been living the same day, over and over. But you’re not THAT stupid.
^But honestly, you’re questioning a lot of things.
^“I need to take a shower,” you say, and run into the bathroom.
Shower_Day_Four: ^You stare at yourself hollow-eyed in the mirror.
^You can’t even decide how you feel right now.

^You have no idea what’s going on. It’s kind of hard to think when you feel like you’ve been running a marathon, but it’s not you who’s running, it’s the firetruck, and it ran into you, and you? You got hit by a firetruck.
^That metaphor didn’t make sense, but like. It’s hard to think.

^You hop into the shower, hoping the cold water will shock your brain back into reality. Your mind continues to race, looking for a reason to explain everything happening today. Or… multiple days, maybe.
Dream_Day_Four: ^Yes. Obviously. You force your racing heart to calm down. It’s one of those freaky, realistic dreams, that mean you’re stressed out and won’t get a lot of sleep.
^It’s weird that the dream keeps happening over and over, but maybe… you don’t know.
^It’s fine. You just have to ride this out.
^You exit the shower, and dress yourself.
ONS_Day_Four: ^Yes. Obviously. Your heart keeps racing, for a different reason.
^You actually managed to pick up a girl? Damn, you’re GOOD. You didn’t think you were that type of person, but things have been weird. Maybe you just were super cool one day.
^It’s also weird that you don’t remember picking up a girl, but maybe you… you don’t know.
^It’s fine. You got a babe. It’s all good.
^You exit the shower, and dress yourself.
Kitchen_Day_Four: ^It seems as though you’ve finally convinced yourself that this is totally normal. Great, time to embrace the day and pretend this is totally NORMAL.
^“Hi, babe! I’m making pancakes. Want some?”
^Gigi waves to you, and that’s when you notice the fat engagement ring on her hand.
Finger_4: ^“Silly, you know we’re getting married, right? You picked this ring out and everything.”
^“We’re getting married? But I don’t know you.”
^“We’ve been engaged for months. I moved in a week ago. I know you’re apprehensive about living together, but… it’s the necessary step--”
^“No. I don’t know you. I mean I do, but… I don’t,” you insist.
^Gigi starts to frown, hurt clear on her face, and you would feel bad, but something’s very wrong here.
Married_Woman_4: ^You start to have a mild panic attack over the fact that you might’ve just had an affair. Fuck. You’re a better person than that.
^“That’s not a funny joke,” she says. “We’re getting married soon… I don’t like you thinking we’re not. We’ve talked about this before.”
^“We’re getting married? But I don’t know you.”
^“We’ve been engaged for months. I moved in a week ago. I know you’re apprehensive about living together, but… it’s the necessary step--”
^“No. I don’t know you. I mean I do, but… I don’t,” you insist.
^Gigi starts to frown, hurt clear on her face, and you would feel bad, but something’s very wrong here.
Normal_4: ^You nod, trying your best to hide your recoil. Gigi smiles, almost - relieved? - and turns back to the pancakes.
^“Good. I’m not so sure how these’ll turn out, but I need to practice cooking, y’know? I can’t make pancakes as good as Jason or Amy, but if we’re getting married soon, I need to…”
^It’s not a proper FIREFIGHTER’S BREAKFAST, but--
Outside_Day_Four: ^“I need some air,” you hear yourself saying.
^Gigi grabs your arm, stopping you. Panicking, you wrench yourself away from her.
^“Don’t go outside,” she says, and she looks terrified.
^For once, her composure is starting to crack. But how would you know this is the first time?
^Okay, you can’t pretend this is normal anymore. You cross your arms.
^“Just come back, let me make pancakes, and… we’ll be fine… we can do whatever you want, yeah?” She’s rambling. “Just don’t go outside, just for one day.”
Going_On_4: ^“Baby, there’s nothing going on,” she tries to reassure you, but her voice is trembling. “Let’s go back to bed, okay?” She takes your arm, trying to lead you out of the doorway.
^As she says that, however, you get a flash of memory. Of the previous… day. Did you meet her parents?
^No, you did. And they were assholes.
^“No, I did, and they were assholes.”
^At that, a flash of annoyance crosses Gigi’s face.
^“I know they were assholes, but that doesn't mean--”
Outside_Four_2: ^You move to go outside once again, but this time, Gigi traps you with her iron grip. You try to pull yourself free, but can’t.
^“Let me go!” You yell, but she’s not letting up.
^“Okay, then, explain to me what the hell is going on!”
^You should be stronger than her. You are stronger than her. And yet, you can’t move from her hold. She’s staring at you with a fierce expression. You can’t tell if it’s out of anger or desperation.
^“Just listen to me! If you go outside, you’ll get hit, and we’ll have to do--”
^She realizes her mistake a second too late.
End_Day_Four: ^You don’t know what that means. You don’t know what any of this means. You try and pull away, again, but now it feels as though you can’t even move.
^“Gigi, please, just tell me what’s going on.”
^Your voice is trembling, too. But she doesn’t seem to hear you. Her gaze is off in the distance.
^All of a sudden, you think you hear sirens. They’re coming from… inside the house? You can’t tell. It’s everywhere.
^You look towards where Gigi is looking. You see a firetruck, hurtling towards your house. Towards you.
^Gigi lets go of you to dodge out of the way. You try to move, but you’re still frozen.
^“No, no, no, this shouldn’t be happening.” she mutters despairingly.
^You only have enough time to think, Help me, before the firetruck hurtling towards you crunches your bones.
Day_Five: ^This time, you know something’s wrong. You can still feel the lingering feeling of your bones being smashed, but you wish you could more clearly remember ANYTHING else. Yesterday’s--No. Today’s? Whatever DAY’s memories are slipping away.
^You were married. Engaged? There was a girl. You can’t go outside. What happens when you go outside? You’re so close to remembering--
^She opens your blinds to let the sunlight in. Why the hell is Amy here?
^“Oh good! You’re awake! Lots to do today. Go shower.”
^She pulls you out of bed and pushes you into the bathroom. Dumbfounded, you stand in the bathroom.
^“Be quick Lyla!! Lots to do lots to do!”
^You don’t bother questioning it anymore, and decide to just go with it. You turn on the water, but something in the mirror catches your eye.
Mirror_5: ^On the mirror, in what you assume is lipstick, is written “Congratulations Lyla and Gigi on the happy marriage”.
^Some memories start coming back. Memories of other days. Memories of this day came back. Gigi, the girl you ran into on the street and went on a date with and met the parents of. Now you’re married?
^You need answers and you need them now.
^You burst out of the bathroom, preparing to demand explanations from Amy. She had a white jumpsuit laid out on your bed.
^She pushes the jumpsuit into your arms, and then turns to pick something off your dresser. You throw the suit back on your bed. You need answers and you need them now.

^She smiles at you, and places a crown of aloe, carnations and honeysuckle. You frown at her, but she doesn’t seem to notice. You look down and find yourself dressed in the suit that you had just thrown away. Are you losing it?

^She takes your hand and pulls you out of your bedroom and to your living room. People are milling about, and congratulating you. No one is listening to you, it’s like everyone is running on autopilot.
^Amy leads you to the front of your house. Someone pushes flowers into your hands. Friends and family are all standing in front of you. Amy stands next to you and squeezes your shoulder.
^She’s not listening, but is instead looking behind you. You follow her gaze and see a girl in a white dress walking up a make-shift aisle. There’s a veil over her face, but you know it’s Gigi.
^It doesn’t take long for her to get there. Without thinking you pull back the veil. It’s Gigi. You want to say something, but you can’t form the words.
^Amy starts talking, but you can’t make out the words. It’s all a blur until--
^“Do you, Lyla, take Gigi, to be your lawfully wedded wife?”
^You finally find your voice. Finally, you’re able to demand what’s going on.
^“I don’t! What is happening?! Why do I keep repeating this day?!”
^“Why is everyday just a nothing day with you? Gigi, what is going on?”
Gigi_Explains_Five: ^“You… you really have been remembering. That hasn’t happened before,” she mumbles.
^The people all around you are frozen, their expressions of matrimonial excitement stretched too wide on their gaunt, too-gray faces.
^But it almost doesn’t matter. Almost. Those things are freaky as hell, but you force yourself to not pay attention.
^“Gigi.” You’ve lost all trace of affection for her at this point. “What the fuck is going on?”
^“We have NOTHING BUT TIME.” You practically scream.
^“I… suppose you’re right, but…” she sighs. “Okay. Okay! First of all, I want to say that I… I’m sorry.”
What_For_5: ^“I… might’ve started the loops.” She bites her lip, expecting an unfavorable reaction from you.
^Which she gets, for your jaw drops.
^“Okay, well, first things first… I kinda have… powers… over time.” She looks away from you. “I’m not a human?”
^“Not human,” you repeat, as if it weren’t a question.
^“I mean,” Gigi rushes to explain. “I’m not an alien, or a demon, or even a god... well, maybe a kinda demon. But I’m not this all-powerful creepy being, I swear!”
^“It’s really hard to believe that, Gigi.”
Cause_This_5: ^She actually has the decency to look ashamed. “I didn’t mean for things to end up like this… but yes, I did start the loops.”
^You can’t stop your voice from going even higher.
^“WHY WOULD YOU EVEN DO THAT? HOW WOULD YOU EVEN--”
^“I’m getting to that!” She rushes to explain. “I… kinda… have powers… over time.” She looks away from you. “I’m not entirely human?”
^“Not human,” you repeat, as if it weren’t a question.
^“I mean,” Gigi rushes to explain. “I’m not an alien, or a demon, or even a god... I’m human. But I can do… things… But I’m not this all-powerful creepy being, I swear!”
^“It’s really hard to believe that, Gigi.”
Believe_Five: ^Gigi sighs, still not looking at you. Her arms grip themselves, tightly, as if she’ll crumble if she lets go.

^“I’m really not,” she’s insisting. “I have to follow the rules of the universe like everyone else. My universe just looks a little different from yours. I can’t fully control time, but I can freeze it, start it over, just for a little…”
^Sadness starts to creep into her eyes.

^“But it was really nice, being able to have a do-over. I mess things up constantly. But I didn’t want to hurt people, I just wanted things to go perfectly. I just wanted to loop once. But now we’re stuck and I… don’t know why.”
^“They sure did get out of hand,” you can’t help yourself from your sarcasm. Gigi ignores you.
^“I… I met you, once, Lyla, way before everything happened. And we really did hit it off that time, I promise.” Gigi finally looks back at you, meeting your gaze. Tears threaten to spill.

^“But I was… too much of a coward. I didn’t ask you out, and we parted ways. But I… I just didn’t want to let you leave. And I thought… I can just do it over, just this once… I don’t know what else I thought. The past gets hard to remember when you’ve been going through it so much.”
^“Things also get hard to remember WHEN YOU DON’T KNOW THAT YOU’VE BEEN LOOPING FOR HOWEVER LONG.”
Happening_5: ^“I’m not sure. But… I will say that you remembering - fully remembering - is new.”

^At that, you pause. Some memories are hazy, but others are becoming clearer. Gigi spilling coffee - no, it wasn’t always coffee - onto you. You and Gigi being at the café… sometimes with her parents, sometimes not. Gigi is always trying to stop you from getting hit by the firetruck. Gigi never answering your questions.

^“Um, no. This is the first time. Because, um, you see… I tried so many things to get us out of the loops. Never leaving your side, or spending days not talking to you… I spent a whole lot of loops studying quantum physics, just in case there was something there. There isn’t, by the way. That stuff is hard.”
Happening_Sarcasm_5: ^“I probably deserve that,” Gigi sighs. “It’s been hard for both of us. I will say that you remembering - fully remembering - is new.”

^At that, you pause. Some memories are hazy, but others are becoming clearer. Gigi spilling coffee - no, it wasn’t always coffee - onto you. You and Gigi being at the café… sometimes with her parents, sometimes not. Gigi always trying to stop you from getting hit by the firetruck. Gigi never answering your questions.

^“Um, no. This is the first time. Because, um, you see… I tried so many things to get us out of the loops. Never leaving your side, or spending days not talking to you… I spent a whole lot of loops studying quantum physics, just in case there was something there. There isn’t, by the way. That stuff is hard.”
^She quiets for a moment, before breathing in deeply. “But then… something happened.”
Love_Five: ^“I fell in love,” Gigi says, as if it were the simplest thing in the world. As if it were inevitable.
Love2_5: ^You don’t know how to respond to that. But Gigi smiles at your expression, as if she understands.

^“It’s okay, you don’t have to respond.” She smiles softly. “I just wanted to say it. Looping so many times… I really got to know you, and… I think I love you. And I--I just thought the wedding--it might be it, y’know? A chance to fix everything.”
^You feel a deafening pressure encase you. But it seems as though Gigi is lost in her own world. Suddenly, she gasps, as if she’s hit upon something.
^It feels like that’s all you’ve been saying, lately.
^“This might be our chance! To break the loop! Don’t you know--fairy tales, and--true love’s kiss?” Gigi’s soft smile has spread into a wide one, her eyes alight with hope.
^She offers her hand to you. The people around you both are still frozen, but for a moment you think you see them crowd closer, their anticipation drawing nearer.
^You look down at yourself. Your perfect diamond ring glistens brightly, almost blinding you. You’re not sure what to do.
^“Marry me, Lyla, and I think we can break the loop.”
Ending_One: ^You look at Gigi, and then to the crowd and back. You know this is wrong, and based on what she said, she knew it was wrong too. Though your memories are still a bit hazy, at least the first few times, you remember hitting it off.
^You don’t know what to say. You can’t marry someone you don’t know, but some part of you does know her.
^You know what? You have been depressingly single for a while now. Gigi may have some weird control over time, which introduces a really weird power dynamic your now realize. But…
^Gigi’s eyes well up with tears. She moves to put the ring on your finger, but you stop her.
^“But, we’re not starting with marriage. No way. You said we met once for real right?”
^“Yes, I spilled coffee on you, b-but I didn’t have the stain stick the first time, so you were a bit mad. And--”
^“So bring us back there. You say you love me, but all I know about you are vague memories and only the things you’ve told me today.”
^Understanding flashes across Gigi’s face. She drops the ring in her hand. It clatters to the floor and rolls into the sea of people.
^Her voice is small and tight. She seems terrified of the idea of having to start over again.
^“No looping. No weird time magic making me forget. I want to remember all of this. But if you want me, you have to do it right.”
^You reach out and hold her face in your hand. She leans into it and closes her eyes.
^“No, Gigi, you can be happy like this. I’m giving you a chance to make this right. Let me keep my memories, and I’ll see you in the morning.”

^She sniffs and nods. The people in the room start moving in reverse around you. The lights start to dim, replaced by the flashing red lights of a firetruck. You don’t hear the sirens this time, only wind whipping around you.
^“And if I EVER find out you did this again to me? Wiping my memories? Looping like this?”
^You look her directly in the eyes, making sure she knows you're serious.
^“No matter how bad a fight. No matter how awkward an encounter. If this happens again, I’m done.”
^You hold out your pinky finger. Childish, you know, but does that really matter at this point?
^Gigi takes a deep breath, and hooks your finger with hers.
^“No more loops. No more memory erasing.”
^A blinding light overtakes you both, as reality seems to collapse in on itself.
Again: ^It’s 9am. It’s still your day off, but this time, you know what happens next. Gigi kept her word, you remember everything. The wedding, her parents. Everything.
Next: ^While getting dressed, you hope Gigi doesn’t feel the need to spill her coffee on you again. You think you’ve been through enough of that. Still, you wear an older top, just in case.
^While pulling on your shoes, there’s a knock on the door. That’s new.
^You open it, and it’s Gigi. She’s holding two togo cups from the cafe around the corner.

^“Hi, uh, I know this isn’t the same but- uhm. Technically you’re supposed to get hit on the way to the cafe- You live! Don't worry… Not trying to cheat death today. My friends in that department would be pissed…”

^You raise an eyebrow. Didn’t think you’d learn that death was a person, or people rather, but you guess you also didn’t think that your potential partner would be some kind of time controlling, demon(?).
^“I--I mean--Uhm… This would be so much easier if I could--UGH!”
^She's stuttering and stumbling all over her words. She takes a breath and holds out one of the cups for you to take.
^“What I’m trying to say is, can we skip all that? Walk in the park instead of a hospital visit on the way to the cafe?”
^You take the cup from her and take a sip, and nod.
^“Yeah, let’s skip the hospital visit, if that’s alright with you.”
^The sky is blue, the birds are chirping, you can feel the sunlight on your face even though you’re inside…
^You have a feeling today is going to be a great day.
Ending_Two: ^You don’t even know what to do with all this information. It’s too much. She can control time? You’ve been looping longer than these past few days? It’s all just…
^You pull off your ring and place it in her hand. You’re going to break this loop. Get away from Gigi. Whatever it is you need to do, you’re doing it.
Goodbye: ^You start to leave, but Gigi grabs your hand.
^You pull your hand away, and make your way to the front door, pushing past the wall of frozen people.
No_Words: ^You can hear her, but you don’t care. You leave, pushing past the wall of frozen people.
Continue_Bad: ^You feel a slight pull behind you. A strong urge to leave, but you’re able to shake it off. You put your hand on the door, and debate looking back but don’t. If you did, you have a feeling you would have just restarted the day all over again.
^You hear Gigi’s one last, sorrowful plea as you walk out the door.
^It’s all pouring down on you. It all feels so fake, but you know it has to be real. The hazy memories are a bit clearer now. The cafe, her parents, the firetruck. You need to break out of this loop.
Walking: ^You start walking, your feet moving before you think, toward the cafe. No. Flashbacks of getting smashed into the pavement flash through your mind.
^You can’t go that way. You need to go somewhere new. A hotel maybe? Yes, a hotel. That’s where you’ll go
^It takes a lot of will, but you turn around, and start walking in the opposite direction.
Hotel: ^You start walking, your feet moving before you think, toward the cafe. No. Flashbacks of getting smashed into the pavement flash through your mind.
^It takes a lot of will, but you turn around, and start walking in the opposite direction.
Conintue_End_2: ^You don’t know how long you were walking or where you were going, but eventually you find yourself at some crummy motel. You check in and flop onto the bed. Some way to spend your day off, huh?
^It’s way too early to go to bed, but you’re just so exhausted from everything. It doesn’t take you long to fall asleep.
End_2_End: ^The alarm clock- No. Your phone ringing jolts you awake. It’s Amy.
^You don’t catch it time to pick up, but see a few texts from her and Jason. All asking if you’re okay and where you are.
^It’s 9am. It’s no longer your day off.
^You could cry in relief. No more Gigi. No more looping. No more.
^You text Amy back that you must have forgotten to set your alarm back, and will be there ASAP. You check out of the motel and start jogging back home.

^While trying to think of the quickest way to get ready, eat and get to the station, you realize that you should probably be paying more attention. Just because you broke out of the loop doesn’t mean-
^You bump into a girl, spilling her coffee all over her. The deja vu hits you hard as you think about Gigi, but you shake it away. You broke out of that.
^She looks up, sees you, and any anger seems to wash away. You help her up.
^“I’m so sorry, I’m usually not so spacey--”
^“It’s no problem. I should have been looking where I was going.”
^“No really, I’m sorry. Can I pay for it? How much was the coffee?”
^She looks at you and smiles. She pulls a pen out of her bag.
^“Tell ya what, I’ll give you my number, and you can make it up to me… Let's say tomorrow night at 6? I know this great little restaurant.”
^You get hit with deja vu again to when you gave Gigi your number. You push those thoughts away again. This girl isn’t Gigi.
^You turn on your charm, and smile at her. She scribbles down her number on your arm, winks at you and walks off.
^Damn, she’s almost as good as you.
^You put the number in your phone and continue your jog home. After showering and getting dressed, you go to text mystery girl before booking it to the station.
^Turns out, she had already texted you first.
^“See you tomorrow, Lyla”, it read, with a winking emoji after.
^You feel your heart drop. You never told her your name. You never gave her your number. You never--
^The sky is blue, the birds are chirping, you can feel the sunlight on your face even though you’re inside…
^Even though today started out great, you have a feeling today is going to be a very, very long day.
Ending_Three: ^You’re ready to just fight. You’re not even sure if this will solve anything, but you just want to punch Gigi.
^As you pull your arm back to punch however--
^you’ve… frozen? Your arm is outstretched, but not in a fist anymore; your palm is open, pointed towards Gigi, almost invitingly. You can’t move it back.
^She hums. “I haven’t been able to do that in a while. That has to be a good sign, right?”
^“Gigi…” You can speak; you’re not sure of what to say, however. How to get through to her.
^“I’m sorry, Lyla, I really am. I didn’t mean to put you through all of this.”
^Gigi takes the wedding bands and puts one on her ring finger. The crowd seems to be moving now, cheering and crying with joy at this scene.
^[She puts the ring on your finger.]
Ring_Five: ^“I love you,” she says, plain and simple, as she slides the ring onto your finger.
^Instantly, you feel yourself moving into place, but you’re not controlling the movements. You try to shift, get yourself out and away from here.
^But you can’t. You can’t do anything.
^A blinding light overtakes you both, as reality seems to collapse in on itself.
Bad_End3: ^It’s 6 am. You have work in an hour. You have to go get ready!

^You get dressed, make sure to stretch, and go about your morning routine. Your muscles feel tight, as if they’ve been stiff for a long time. Hm, that’s weird. Maybe you’ll take an extra hot shower when you get home tonight.

^“Hiya, babe! I made some food before you go out for work.”
^Oh, right. Gigi made you breakfast. It makes sense for your wife to make you a proper firefighter’s breakfast. You’re not sure why you questioned that.
^You suppose it has been a while.
^“Damn, making sausages AND eggs? What’s the special occasion?” You joke.
^She giggles. “I wanted to do something nice for you. I think today is going to be a great day, don’t you?”
^As you take a bite of your eggs, you find yourself nodding.
^The sky is blue, the birds are chirping, you can feel the sunlight on your face even though you’re inside…
^You have a feeling today is going to be a great day.
Ending_Four: ^As you’re staring at the ring, you realize.
^In a world where the rational doesn’t work, you must turn to the irrational.
E4_Ring: ^You rip the ring off your finger and, in one swift motion, plop it into your mouth. It goes down easily.
^You also grab the wedding bands and eat them too, for good measure.
^The crowd roars back to life, immediately descending into chaos. No-one gets any closer, however. A ring bearer you’ve never seen before perhaps looks the most upset.
^“I… I… What?”  She pulls her hand back, unsure of what to make of you. “Why would you...”
^“Sorry, but I had to do it,” you respond.
^Gigi is sputtering. Her eyes dart around wildly, as if not sure what to make of anything. Eventually, her gaze returns to you, her face twisting into… anger?
^“DO YOU REALLY THINK THAT’LL WORK? EATING SOME FUCKING RINGS?”

^Huh. You don’t fully remember looping, but this might be the first time Gigi has gotten this angry. You want to respond with a smart reason, but really, you don’t have one!  Maybe now’s the time to say a witty one liner.
^“I’m not going to live by your rules anymore.”

Rules_5: ^“I’m not going to live by your rules anymore.”
^At that, Gigi’s anger dissolves into a look of confusion.

^“I never saw it,” she says, dazedly.
Fuck_5: ^The anger seems to go out of Gigi. She sighs.
^“That’s fair,” she agrees, and oh, you weren’t really expecting that. Your awesome moment is ruined.
RedLights_5: ^The lights you might see from a firetruck. But you don’t hear any sirens--no, instead, there’s a rush of wind, as if the air was being sucked out of the room.

Happy_End4: ^You remember everything. The meet-cutes, the arguments, the wedding, the loops. Gigi. All of it. Are you still trapped?

^Hey! It’s 9! You were supposed to be at work 2 hours ago! Everything ok? :0
^It’s a work day. It’s a work day.
^Years of exhaustion lift from your shoulders. You’re free.
^You bound out the door, laughing all the while, a newfound giddiness within you.
